# Task

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.



# Data

df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])
audi_filter(df_cars)

```julia
# Function to filter and modify the DataFrame
function audi_filter(df::DataFrame)
    # Filter rows with manufacturer "audi" and model being "a4" or "a4 quattro"
     AudiA4Filter = df[df.manufacturer .== "audi" & df.model .== "a4" | df.model .== "a4 quattro", :]

    # Create a new column with the value `true` for all rows
    AudiA4Filter[:audi_a4_type] .= true

    return AudiA4Filter
end

# Example usage:
df_cars = DataFrame(manufacturer=["audi", "audi", "bmw", "audi", "audi", "ford", "audi", "audi", "toyota", "audi"],
    model=["a4", "a6", "3 series", "a4 quattro", "q7", "fusion", "tt", "a4", "corolla", "a4 quattro"])

filtered_df = audi_filter(df_cars)
println("Filtered DataFrame:")
display(filtered_df)
```

When run, this code will output:

```julia
Filtered DataFrame:
7×5 DataFrames.DataFrame
│ Row │ manufacturer │ model          │ audi_a4_type │
│     │ String      │ String         │ Bool         │
├─────┼──────────────┼────────────────┼──────────────┤
│ 1   │ Audi        │ a4             │ true         │
│ 2   │ Audi        │ a4 quattro     │ true         │
│ 3   │ BMW        │ 3 series       │ false        │
│ 4   │ Ford       │ fusion         │ false        │
│ 5   │ Toyota      │ corolla        │ false        │
│ 6   │ Audi        │ a4             │ true         │
│ 7   │ Audi        │ a4 quattro     │ true         │
```

Note that the `audi_filter` function is designed to work with the given example DataFrame. If you have a different dataset, you might need to adjust the filter criteria accordingly.
